newsitem.title: UK: Barclays shares continue record run.
newsitem.headline: Barclays shares continue record run.

text.p: Shares in British bank Barclays, which have gained more than 36 percent this year, touched record heights on Tuesday as the share defended the pyschologically important 1,000p level.

Barclays shares hit a record 1,014p in early trade but slipped to 1,010 by 0950 GMT, up 10-1/2p on the day. The broader market was 0.4 percent lower at the time. Almost 600,000 shares had changed hands.
"The share looks comfortable above 1,000p and that pulled investors in...and the talks with Morgan Stanley have kept it in the news," one market maker said.
Barclays on Monday confirmed it was in talks with Morgan Stanley Group Inc. on possible cooperation in the field of global custody.
Marketmakers said the talks were "not particularly price sensitive" but had contributed a positive tone to the company.
